name: Hotel Best Western Alexandra Saint Malo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is was our fourth visit to the Hotel Alexandra and we were not disappointed. The staff were friendly, efficient and professional. Our bedroom had every amenity needed, which is not always available in a higher rating hotel. The food served in the restaurant was very good and certainly on a par with outside restaurants. Breakfast was buffet style and was very varied. We have no hesitation in recommending this establishment.
reviews.title: Our favourite Saint Malo stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a lot of good things to say about the Alexandra. The price is reasonable. Our room was large enough and comfortable with a view out over the sea. There is a promenade between the hotel and the seafront but no vehicular traffic, so the room was quiet except for the sound of the waves. There is parking, which you should reserve when you book, but it is tight and you don't want to have a large car, nor do you want to be going in and out frequently.The walled city is about 20-25 minutes away on foot, but the walk is pleasant along the promenade for most of the distance.
reviews.title: Good hotel with view over the sea.
Good experience
reviews.text: The restaurant was a disappointment. The food was average at best, and the service amateurish. There are some simple restaurants nearby, but we stayed only one night and so cannot comment on them. Eating in Saint-Malo is a possibility, but the walk back afterwards would deter many people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we recommend the Alexandra for tourists arriving by automobile, as it is difficult to be closer to the walled town without paying a premium price.
reviews.title: Lovely room, fantastic view!

reviews.text: The room we were given looked directly on to the sea. There is direct access to the promenade which leads in one direction to St. Malo and the other to Parame. The room was well appointed with the exception of the wardrobe space which was narrow and limited. The air conditioning worked well. The bathroom was a good size and bathrobes were provided. The room had a hospitality tray which was replenished daily. The car parking was plentiful although access to the street needed some care. The reception staff were charming and helpful. The WiFi worked well except for the need to have the user name and password renewed every 3 days. An unusual number of U.K. channels were provided (BBC 1,2,3 and 4).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very hard to find. Staff are first class and rooms pleasant. Food terrible and far too expensive. Parking and breakfast charges are extortionate.
reviews.title: will not stay again..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel based on an old Michelin book we had and were pleasantly surprised. Right on the beach, with a restaurant overlooking the water, quiet location on a side street off the main street. Parking is on the hotel property and gated, at 10 euros/night. Front desk staff was very accomodating and helpful. Our room for 2 was large compared to Paris accommodations, with room for 2 suitcases. It was clean and had all the amenities. The hotel is a 15-20 minute walk from the old town: part of this is can be done on the boardwalk behind the hotels that line the beach. We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice surprise

likes.disliked: — pricey for what you could get in North America

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have always enjoyed our stay at Hotel Alexandra and again, this time, were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Continuity of Standard

reviews.text: The standard of the room is excellent (as other reviewers have said the seaside rooms are a must). Breakfast is very good and varied and the dinner in the restaurant is not to be missed. Staff are very pleasant and helpful. An excellent hotel in Saint Malo
reviews.title: Love the beach love the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here over the years a fabulous location nice walk into St Malo.The Hotel rooms a great get one on the front ,sea view, great french cuisine .Just spend hours watching the surfers and promenades you wont be disappointed LOVE IT
reviews.title: Best stay in St Malo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have been to St Malo twice in the last two years - done my research and have chosen to stay at his hotel both times. It is unparalleled for its beach location. From your room you can sit on a small balcony or in a glass enclosed bay window (my favourite and suggest you ask for one of these rooms) and see the ocean rise and fall (huge tide) and watch the many activities on the beach. The hotel has a very good restaurant or you can do what we did and walk up the beach or the incredible paved walkway to the historic St Malo old town where you are literally surrounded by restaurants (20min stroll). The rooms are medium sized with a separate toilet and well equipped bathroom. Beds are extremely comfortable and the windows open to let in fresh air and relaxing sea sounds. There is no traffic noise and you rarely hear a sound from other guests. The Tv offers many different language channels (great for us as we have been, on a long holiday, bereft of a choice of English speaking channels for a while). Parking is very easy in this hotel. Every morning I raised the blinds and was blown away by the view. This is a truly truly great small hotel in a wonderful location run by people who care about the quality of your stay.
reviews.title: No fall in standards

reviews.text: I first stayed here in 2005,shortly after renovation.I was impressed then,and there has been no deterioration since.The location on the pedestrian-only promenade is as delighful as ever.The sound of the surf remains the only sound at night.My room was very comfortable ,with best quality linen and a firm bed.The bathroom is in perfect condition,and predates silly styling fads,so that it is actually possible to wash in tne basin.There is even a drying line over the bath.
reviews.title: Small tour in Brittany
